topic.title: Measurement With Reference Range Result - conformance rules

section.p: An observation of the quantity of the analyte found within the sample. Note that loinc and procedure codes are identifying more specifically the type of test being performed. Because there may be multiple methodologies available to measure the same substance, these codes are more specific than the analyte and testCode referenced in the ChemistryTest class. Note that this class has 5 subtypes to handle the different kinds of result values. Most chemistry tests are physical quanties (e.g., mg/dL). Some are coded, and even those that normally are physical quantities might be replaced by a coded observation of Quantity Not Sufficient.

ol.li: Extends Reportable Result

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
A unique identifier assigned to reference the investigative procedure performed.

Contains zero or one [0..1] interpretation with data type Code
Provides an automated indication of the result, based upon "normal" values as indicated by the reference range. Examples include High, Low, Critically High, Critically Low, etc.

Contains zero or one [0..1] referenceRange with data type Physical Quantity Interval
The range of normal values (low and high) determined for a test. For toxicology, this range is the theraputic range.

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
Identifies the status of an investigative procedures performed in the laboratory.

Contains exactly one [1..1] value with data type Any
The value of the Chemistry Observation expressed as free-form text.
Contains zero or more [0..*] referenceRangeCriterion, where its type is Reference Range Criterion

Contains zero or one [0..1] deviceInstance, where its type is Device Instance
A unique identifier assigned to reference the device used for the investigative procedure performed.
Extends Reportable Result
Contains exactly one [1..1] dateDeemedReportable with data type Point In Time

Contains exactly one [1..1] dateObserved with data type Point In Time
Contains the Date and Time the observation of the results were made.

Contains exactly one [1..1] isAmended with data type Boolean
Identifies whether the Microbiology test performed was amended. 0 = no and 1 = yes.

Contains zero or one [0..1] probability with data type Real
"This field contains the probability of a result being true for results with categorical values. It mainly applies to discrete coded results. It is a decimal number represented as an ASCII string that must be between 0 and 1, inclusive. " - HL7 V2
Contains exactly one [1..1] reportDate with data type Point In Time

Contains exactly one [1..1] reportId with data type Id
Contains the unique identifier for the microbiology result.
Contains exactly one [1..1] reportStatus with data type Code

Contains exactly one [1..1] testCode with data type Code
An identifier code for the observation or ordered test. This can be based on local and/or universal codes. The WKLD CODE file (#64) is used to identify the observed test. It contains the VA National Laboratory Test code. Future versions may utilize LOINC codes as an additional coding system.
Contains zero or one [0..1] userDefinedAccessCheck with data type Code

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
A unique identifier assigned to reference the investigative procedure performed.

Contains zero or one [0..1] interpretation with data type Code
Provides an automated indication of the result, based upon "normal" values as indicated by the reference range. Examples include High, Low, Critically High, Critically Low, etc.

Contains zero or one [0..1] referenceRange with data type Physical Quantity Interval
The range of normal values (low and high) determined for a test. For toxicology, this range is the theraputic range.

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
Identifies the status of an investigative procedures performed in the laboratory.

Contains exactly one [1..1] value with data type Any
The value of the Chemistry Observation expressed as free-form text.
Contains exactly one [1..1] author, where its type is Author
Contains zero or one [0..1] autopsyEvent, where its type is _ Autopsy Event

Contains zero or more [0..*] commentEvent, where its type is Comment Event
An association linking a comment pertinent to the result of the lab test promise.
Contains zero or one [0..1] medicalDirector, where its type is Responsible Party

Contains exactly one [1..1] performer, where its type is Individual Provider
"This field identifies the performing technician." - HL7 Version 2.8, OBR-34
Contains zero or more [0..*] interpretation, where its type is Interpretation Event

Contains zero or one [0..1] laboratoryDirector, where its type is Individual Provider
This is the director of the laboratory that is reporting the result to the Orderer. This person may or may not be the director of the organization that actually performed the analysis, rather of the reporting organization.
Contains zero or more [0..*] transcription, where its type is Transcription Event
Contains zero or more [0..*] referenceRangeCriterion, where its type is Reference Range Criterion

Contains zero or one [0..1] deviceInstance, where its type is Device Instance
A unique identifier assigned to reference the device used for the investigative procedure performed.
